page.title: 01A GENERAL VIEW
page.content: A gentle bend in the picturesque River Wye forms the most prominent feature in the area. To either side of this one sees rolling hills with most of the land being used for growing crops and grazing for sheep and cattle. This is an area where one sees many more farm animals than people. Some remote farmhouses can be found by those who are prepared to leave their cars and follow the many footpaths which are signposted. But it is the River Wye which holds the attraction for most visitors into the area, whether it is for some fishing, or rafting, or canoeing, or merely to find a peaceful camping spot.
